page.title: 14Park Hall Country Park cont.
page.content: and picnic areas were developed in the park.The land was cleared of any remaining rubbish and was attractively landscaped. There are 470 acres of parkland but only 330 acres are used for recreation to the public.The remaining acerage is given over to commercial farming.The most popular pastime in the park is dog walking and leisure walking.Other pastimes which can be undertaken in the park are horse riding,fishing,jogging,barbecues, picnics,sponsored walks,biology and geology field trips,orienteering and model aeroplane flying. Around 150 different types of birds have been recorded in the park these include the common meadow pipit and also the whinchat and wheatear. Birds of prey are also well represented
